definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: This very hot aspect could produce angry outbursts.
sentences.chinese: 这个火爆的合相将会带来愤怒的爆发。

sentences.english: He is very quick-tempered, so no-one dares to offend him.
sentences.chinese: 他的脾气很火爆，一般人不敢惹他。

sentences.english: If Gibson fails to keep a check on his temper, he could end up burnt at the stake.
sentences.chinese: 如果吉普森没忍住他的火爆脾气，那他将燃火自焚。

sentences.english: Dixieland jazz is red hot and popular with many people.
sentences.chinese: 迪克西兰爵士乐是非常受欢迎的火爆音乐。

sentences.english: Compared with the fever in Hangzhou, some apartments are much colder.
sentences.chinese: 与此火爆的场面相比，有的楼盘则显得冷清许多。

sentences.english: I think the venue is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得演出地点是非常火爆的。

sentences.english: Land disputes became overheated and were frequently resolved at the point of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 土地争端变得火爆异常，而且基本上是枪杆子说了算。

sentences.english: Paul was a fiery person but is restrained in today's reading.
sentences.chinese: 保禄是个火爆的人，在今天的读经，却显得克制。

sentences.english: His hair-trigger temper can fly even toward his best friends.
sentences.chinese: 在最好的朋友面前他也照样脾气火爆。

sentences.english: His book of selected paintings is selling well at Books Plaza.
sentences.chinese: 他的画选正在图书大厦出售，销量火爆。

sentences.english: Some of these sites are already quite popular.
sentences.chinese: 上面提到的这些站点已经相当火爆。

sentences.english: So yeah, it's really, really big.
Sora is not just hot in China, but also surprisingly popular.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，苍井空不仅仅是出名，她异常火爆。

sentences.english: His bilious temperament was apparent to all who heard him rant about his difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 听过他咆哮事易办的己都晓得他的火爆脾气。
是的，园艺在这里很火爆。

sentences.english: Shark attacks and ice-cream sales both rise in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 鲨鱼袭击人类和冰淇淋销售在这个夏天都异常火爆。

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
to go online/to put sth online
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
